summary: The 'Stop Sexual Harassment in K–12 Act' aims to strengthen Title IX enforcement in elementary and secondary schools. It mandates increased Title IX Coordinator staffing, outlines their duties (including outreach, monitoring complaints, and training), and offers grants for training on responding to sex-based harassment. The bill also requires the Department of Education to develop and administer an anonymous survey on sex-based harassment, with results made public. It provides grants to agencies to help meet the bill's requirements.
